messages.subject: Commercial Message, Rare WW2 Japanese Diplomat sword
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, I have just added a pretty rare sword to my site. Although it isn t true nihonto, it is a WW2 era Japanese Diplomatic Officers sword. We seldom see
messages.messageBody:
Hello,

I have just added a pretty rare sword to my site. Although it isn't true nihonto, it is a WW2 era Japanese Diplomatic Officers sword. We seldom see these swords, especially in this condition. It seems to be a copy of a British designed court sword.

Here is the link: www.japaneseswordcollector.com


Regards

Louis


Link: www.japaneseswordcollector.com


Louis Skebo

www.japaneseswordcollector.com

---------------------------------
Yahoo! FareChase - Search multiple travel sites in one click.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: tekkotsu question
messages.msgSnippet: greetings all. Recently, and somewhere, I read that tekkotsu in the corners of square tsuba was peculiar to one or two tsuba ha. I think maybe Ko Shoami was
messages.messageBody:
greetings all. Recently, and somewhere, I read that tekkotsu in the
corners of square tsuba was peculiar to one or two tsuba ha. I think
maybe Ko Shoami was one, I can't remember the other. Does anyone have
information on this ?, I am stumped as to where I read it, I have been
through my books 1/2 a dozen times over the weekend and cannot find it
for the life of me.

any help appreciated

cheers

Rich

messages.subject: sword attack
messages.msgSnippet: Hello All, These attacks on people with Samurai Swords are the exact reason there has been legislation enacted already with more being contemplated in
messages.messageBody:
Hello All, These attacks on people with 'Samurai Swords' are the exact
reason there has been legislation enacted already with more being
contemplated in certain parts of the world. It isn't until legislators
and the population in general realise that if it wasn't these cheap
replica edged weapons being used it would be something else just just
as deadly, eg. machete, axe etc. In fact most violent crime is
committed with weapons of chance (those that are to hand during fits
of rage) and those crimes of violence committed by persons who make
conscious use of a weapon in a planned way would in no way be stopped
from their crime by legislation that bans or restricts legitimate
collectors rights. This affects us and we should be aware that some
would believe that legislating against possession of edged weapons
would make society safer. John
